text: A Problem Set on Polynomials Aditya Ghosh 1. Solve the equation: 6x4 − 25x3 + 12x2 + 25x + 6 = 0. 2. Let a, b, c ∈ R. Prove that this equation (x − a)(x − b) + (x − b)(x − c) + (x − c)(x − a) = 0 has real roots and the roots are equal if and only if a = b = c. 3. Prove that ax2 + bx + c = 0 does not have any rational root if a, b, c are all odd integers. 4. If x = 2 is a root of the equation mx3 − 12x2 + 10x − m = 0 then ﬁnd the other roots. 5. Suppose k is a real number such that the equations x2 − 4x + k = 0 and x2 + kx − 4 = 0 have exactly one common root. Find the value of k. 6. Let f (x) = x3 − 3x + b and g(x) = x2 + bx − 3, where b ∈ R. What is the sum of all possible values of b such that f (x) = 0 and g(x) = 0 have a common root? 7. Suppose 1, 2, 3 are roots of x4 + ax2 + bx = c. Find value of c. 8. If a ̸= b, c ̸= 0 and if the equations x2 + ax + bc = 0 and x2 + bx + ca = 0 have a common root, then their other roots satisfy x2 + cx + ab = 0. 9. Suppose k, l, p, q ∈ N such that if a, b are roots of x2 − kx + l = 0 then a + 1/b and b + 1/a are roots of x2 − px + q = 0. Find sum of all possible values of q. 10. Suppose P (x) is a polynomial with P (2) = 2017 and P (5) = 2002. If it is given that P (x) = 0 has exactly one integer root, ﬁnd that root. 11. Suppose that the roots of x2 + αx − a = 0 are β, γ, and the roots of x2 + βx − b = 0 are γ, α. If 2(a + b + c) = α2 + β2 + γ2, then show that the roots of x2 + γx − c = 0 are α, β. 12. Suppose a, b are integers and b ̸= −1. Show that if x2 + ax + b + 1 = 0 has an integer root then a2 + b2 must be composite. 13. Let f (x) be a quadratic polynomial. Prove that there exists quadratic polynomials g(x), h(x) such that f (x)f (x + 1) = g(h(x)). 14. Solve the equation for real x: (x2 + x − 2)3 + (2x2 − x − 1)3 = 27(x2 − 1)3. 15. The roots of the equation x3 −3ax2 +bx+18c = 0 form a non-constant arithmetic progression and the roots of the equation x3+bx2+x−c3 = 0 form a non-constant geometric progression. Given that a, b ∈ N and c ∈ R, ﬁnd all possible values of a, b. 16. Let P (x) = x2 + 1 2 x + b and Q(x) = x2 + cx + d be two polynomials with real coefﬁcients, such that, P (x)Q(x) = Q(P (x)) for all real x. Find all real roots of P (Q(x)) = 0. 17. Suppose m, n are integers such that x2 + mx − n = 0 and x2 − mx + n = 0 both have integer roots. Then show that n is divisible by 6. 1 18. Suppose a ≤ b ≤ c and a + b + c = 9, ab + bc + ca = 26 and abc = 24. Find the value of 100a + 10b + c. 19. Show that for all real numbers x, y, z satisfying x + y + z = 0 and xy + yz + zx = −3, the value of the expression x3y + y3z + z3x is a constant. 20. Suppose all roots of the equation x4 − 4x3 + ax2 + bx + 1 = 0 are positive real numbers. Find the value of (a + b). 21. The polynomial x3 − ax2 + bx − 2010 has three positive integer zeros. What is the smallest possible value of a? 22. Suppose that the polynomial f (x) = x3 − 3x2 + ax + 15 has three roots, two of which sum to 8. What is the value of (−a)? 23. Let P (x) be a nonzero polynomial such that (x − 1)P (x + 1) = (x + 2)P (x) for every real x, and P (2)2 = P (3). Find the leading coefﬁcient of P (x). 24. Suppose f (x) = x4 + ax3 + bx2 + cx + d is a polynomial such that f (1) = 10, f (2) = 20, f (3) = 30. Find the value of (f (12) + f (−8))/640. 25. For certain real numbers a, b, and c, the polynomial g(x) = x3 +ax2 +x+10 has three distinct roots, and each root of g(x) is also a root of the polynomial f (x) = x4 + x3 + bx2 + 100x + c. Determine the value of c + 10a. 26. Let P (x) = ax3 + bx2 + cx + d where a, b, c, d ∈ Z such that ad is odd and bc is even. Prove that exactly two zeros of the polynomial are irrational. 27. Suppose that n is a positive integer. Show that the equation x2 − 2014x + 19(n2 + 1) = 0 can not have any rational root. 28. Let f (x) = x3 + ax2 + bx + c and g(x) = x3 + bx2 + cx + a where a, b, c ∈ Z, c ̸= 0. Suppose f (1) = 0 and roots of g(x) = 0 are squares of the roots of f (x) = 0. Find the value of a2020 + b2020 + c2020. 29. Let P (x) = x3 + ax2 + b and Q(x) = x3 + bx + a, where a, b, c are non-zero real numbers. Suppose roots of P (x) = 0 are reciprocals of the roots of Q(x) = 0. Prove that a, b are integers and then ﬁnd the gcd of P (2020! + 1) and Q(2020! + 1). 30. Let a, b, c be the roots of the equation x3 − 3x2 + 2x − 1 = 0. Suppose that P (x) is a cubic polynomial that satisﬁes P (a) = b + c, P (b) = c + a, and P (c) = a + b. If P (ab + bc + ca) = 11, determine P (abc). 31. If a, b, c are the roots of x3+2x2+3x+3 = 0, ﬁnd the value of ( a a + 1 )3+( b b + 1 )3+( c c + 1 )3. 32. Prove that 3 √ 2 + √5 + 3 √ 2 − √5 is an integer. 2 33. Let a, b, c distinct integers. Can the polynomial (x − a)(x − b)(x − c) − 1 be factored into the product of two non-constant polynomials with integer coefﬁcients? 34. The product of two of the four roots of the equation x4 − 18x3 + kx2 + 200x − 1984 = 0 is −32. Find k. 35. For real numbers a, b, c deﬁne sn = an + bn + cn. Suppose s1 = 2, s2 = 6 and s3 = 14. Prove that |s2 n − sn−1sn+1| = 8 holds for all n > 1. 36. Show that (1 + x + x2 + · · · + xn)2 − xn can be expressed the product of two polynomials. 37. Suppose a, b, c are non-zero real numbers satisfying (ab + bc + ca)3 = abc(a + b + c)3. Prove that a, b, c must be terms of a geometric progression. 38. Let P (x) = xn +an−1xn−1 +· · ·+a1x+a0 be a polynomial with integral coefﬁcients. Suppose that there exist four distinct integers a, b, c, d with P (a) = P (b) = P (c) = P (d) = 5. Prove that there is no integer k with P (k) = 8. 39. A polynomial P (x) with degree n satisﬁes P (k) = k/(k +1) for k = 0, 1, . . . , n. Find P (n+1). 40. Find all polynomials P (x) that satisﬁes xP (x − 1) = (x − 7)P (x) for all x ∈ R. 41. Find all polynomials P (x) such that P (x + 1) = P (x) + 2x + 1 holds for all x ∈ R. 42. Let a, b, c ∈ C such that the roots of the equation ax2 + bx + c = 0 have same modulus. Prove that a = 0 if and only if b = 0. 43. Given a + 1/a + a2 + 1/a2 + 1 = 0, ﬁnd am + 1/am + a2m + 1/a2m. Here a ∈ C. 44. Suppose A(x), B(x), C(x) polynomials with complex coefﬁcients satisfying A(x3)+xB(x3) = (1 + x + x2)C(x) for all x ∈ C. Prove that, A(1) = 0. 45. Suppose that P (x), Q(x), R(x), S(x) are polynomials such that P (x5) + xQ(x5) + x2R(x5) = (x4 + x3 + x2 + x + 1)S(x) for all x ∈ C. Prove that x − 1 is a factor of P (x). 46. If x1, x2, ...., x2019 are the zeros of P (x) = x2019 + 2019x − 1, ﬁnd the value of 2019∑ i=1 xi xi − 1 . 47. Suppose that the polynomial 1 − x + x2 − x3 + · · · + x16 − x17 can be written as a0 + a1y + a2y2 + · · · + a17y17, where y = x + 1. Determine the value of a2. 48. Let a, b, c be roots of the polynomial P (x) = x3 − 4x2 + 4x + 5. Determine the value of 1 − a3 b + c + 1 − b3 c + a + 1 − c3 a + b . 49. Suppose a1, a2, . . . , an are all distinct integers. If n is odd, prove that the polynomial P (x) = (x − a1)(x − a2) . . . (x − an) + 1 cannot be factored into the product of two non-constant polynomials with integer coefﬁcients. Does it hold when n is even? 3 50. If a1, a2, . . . , an are distinct integers, show that P (x) = (x − a1)2(x − a2)2 . . . (x − an)2 + 1 can not be factored into the product of two non-constant polynomials with integer coefﬁcients. 51. Find all values of a ∈ R such that x4 − 2ax2 + x + a2 − a = 0 has only real roots. 52. Let a ∈ R, a ̸= 0. Find all real roots of the equation a3x4 + 2a2x2 + x + a + 1 = 0. 53. Find all real numbers a for which the equation x2 + (a − 2)x + 1 = 3|x| has exactly three distinct real solutions in x. 54. Suppose that the roots of the equation x4 + ax3 + bx2 + ax + c = 0 are α1, α2, α3, and α4. Show that, (α2 1 + 1)(α2 2 + 1)(α2 3 + 1)(α2 4 + 1) = (1 − b + c)2. 55. Suppose f (x) is a polynomial such that f (xn) is divisible by x−1. Show that f (xn) is divisible by xn − 1. 56. Let P (x) be a non-zero polynomial with real coefﬁcients satisfying P (x2) = P (x)P (x − 1) for all x ∈ C. Prove that, (i) if P (α) = 0 for some α ∈ C then α = 0 or |α| = 1. (ii) Is it possible that P (0) = 0? (iii) Find all such polynomial P (x). 57. Find all non-constant polynomials P (x) with real coefﬁcients which satisfy the equation P (x)P (x + 1) = P (x2) for all x ∈ C. 58. Suppose polynomial P (x) satisﬁes P (x2 +1) = P (x)2 +1 and P (0) = 0. Prove that, P (x) = x. 59. Find the sum of the real roots of the equation 5x4 − 10x3 + 10x2 − 5x = 11. 60. Find number of real roots of ax7 − 4x4 + x2 + 1 = 0 where a > 2. 61. Let a, b, c, x, y, z be six positive real numbers satisfying x + y + z = a + b + c and xyz = abc. Further, suppose that a ≤ x < y < z ≤ c and a < b < c. Prove that a = x, b = y and c = z. 62. Suppose that a, b, c, d, e, f are positive integers such that n = a + b + c + d + e + f divides both abc + def and ab + bc + ca − de − ef − f d. Prove that n must be composite. 63. Prove that there does not exist a non-constant polynomial P (x) with integer coefﬁcients such that P (n) is prime number for each non-negative integer n. 64. Prove that there does not exist a non-constant polynomial P (x) with integer coefﬁcients such that P (n) is prime number for each positive integer n. 65. Show that any monic even degree polynomial with coefﬁcients odd natural numbers cannot have a rational root. 66. Suppose that p(x) is a cubic polynomial such that the graph of y = p(x) contains the points A(2, 4), B(3, 9), and C(4, 16). The lines AB, BC and CA intersect the graph again at points D, E, F respectively. If the sum of x-coordinates of D, E, F is 24, then ﬁnd 5p(0). 4 67. Let P (x) = a0xn + · · · + an−1x + an be a polynomial with integer coefﬁcients. Suppose the equation P (x) = 0 has n distinct integer roots which are pairwisely coprime. Then prove that an−1 and an must be coprime. 68. Let α be a real root of the equation x5 − x3 + x − 2 = 0. Prove that, ⌊α6⌋ = 3. 69. Let a, b, c ∈ R+ such that a + b + c = 1. Let λ = min{a3 + a2bc, b3 + ab2c, c3 + abc2}. Prove that the roots of the equation x2 + x + 4λ = 0 are real. 70. Show that there can not exist polynomial P (x) with integer coefﬁcients such that for some a, b, c ∈ Z, it holds that P (a) = b, P (b) = c, P (c) = a. 71. Let P1(x) = ax2 − bx − c, P2(x) = bx2 − cx − a, P3(x) = cx2 − ax − b be three polynomials where a, b, c are non-zero real numbers. Suppose there exists a real number α such that P1(α) = P2(α) = P3(α). Prove that, a = b = c. 72. If p(x) = a0 + a1x + · · · + amxm is a polynomial with real coefﬁcients, deﬁne S(p(x)) = a2 0 + a2 1 + · · · + a2 m. Let f (x) = 3x2 + 7x + 2. Find, with proof, a polynomial g(x) with real coefﬁcients such that g(0) = 1 and S(f (x)n) = S(g(x)n) holds for every integer n ≥ 1. 73. Alice and Bob play the following game. Alice thinks of a polynomial p(x) with non-negative integer coefﬁcients and Bob has to guess the polynomial. Bob has two shots: he can pick a number a and ask Alice to return the value of p(a), and then Bob has another such try. Can Bob always guess the polynomial? 74. Find quotient and remainder when xn is divided by x2 − x − 1. 75. Find all pairs of integers (a, b) such that the polynomial ax15 + bx14 + 1 is divisible by the polynomial x2 − x − 1. 76. A Polynomial h(x) having integer coefﬁcients is called ‘cute’ if it can be expressed as h(x) = f (x)2 + g(x)2 where f, g are polynomials with integer coefﬁcients. Suppose P (x) is a cute polynomial with P (0) = 2020. Prove that P (x) + 2x can not be a cute polynomial. 77. Let a1, a2, a3, a4 be real numbers satisfying a1 k2 + 1 + a2 k2 + 2 + a3 k2 + 3 + a4 k2 + 4 = 1 k2 for k = 1, 2, 3, 4. Find the value of a1 26 + a2 27 + a3 28 + a4 29 . 78. Let P (x) be a polynomial of degree n such that P (k) = 2k holds for each k = 0, 1, 2, · · · , n. Determine P (n + 1). 79. Suppose F is a function deﬁned on the set of real numbers such that F (x) > x for all x ≥ 0. Find all polynomials P (x) such that P (0) = 0 and P (F (x)) = F (P (x)) holds for all x ∈ R. 80. Let P1(x) = x2 − 2 and deﬁne Pj(x) = P1(Pj−1(x)) for j = 2, 3, · · · . Prove that for any positive integer n, the 2n roots of the equation Pn(x) = x are all real and distinct. 5
